author: Al Jazeera English
description:
On the sunny beaches of Southern California, surfers and swimmers often share the waves… with sharks! Researchers reveal that encounters with great white sharks are more common than you might think.

Al Jazeera’s John Hendren reports.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
'More to come'.
Those are the words of the US War Secretary after his country carried out a wave of air strikes against the Islamic State in north-western Nigeria.
Pete Hegseth said the aim is to stop the killing of what he called innocent Christians.
President Donald Trump warned the US would take action against the group if the Nigerian government - in his words - continued to allow the targeting of Christians.
Many say Trump was pressured by right wing Christian base in the US to carry out those attacks in this African country.
But what what could be the fallout?

Presenter: Adrian Finighan

Guests:
Malik Samuel, Senior Researcher at Good Governance Africa.
Ebenezer Obadare, Senior Fellow for Africa Studies at the Council on Foreign Relations.
David Otto, Deputy Director of Counterterrorism Training at the International Academy for the Fight Against Terrorism.

Subscribe to our channel: http://bit.ly/AJSubscribe
Follow us on X : https://twitter.com/AJEnglish
Find us on Facebook: ht
title: Do Donald Trump's strikes in Nigeria serve any purpose? | Inside Story

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Kyiv was hit by a large-scale attack last night, involving over 500 drones and dozens of missiles, leaving more than 28 people injured and one dead. Many areas are without electricity or water, amid ongoing strikes on Ukraine’s critical energy infrastructure.

Al Jazeera’s Audrey Macalpine reports.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
For decades, NATO has been anchored by American money, power, and leadership. But that foundation is now under strain. As President Donald Trump pushes allies to dramatically raise military spending, and pares back Washington's own commitments, questions are growing over how much leverage the US still holds among its European allies.

Al Jazeera’s Resul Serdar reports.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Libya mourns the death of General Muhammad al-Haddad, a unifying and charismatic leader who played a key role in easing tensions and fostering peace in Tripoli. Thousands of Libyans have gathered to offer condolences to his family in Misrata, where funeral preparations continue. Haddad’s deputy, General Salah al-Namrouj, has been temporarily appointed, but replacing a figure of his influence will be challenging. Meanwhile, tensions persist in other regions, including continued Israeli raids in the occupied West Bank.

Al Jazeera’s Malik Traina reports.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Political instability in Myanmar is spilling across borders, leaving tens of thousands of refugees stranded in India’s Mizoram state. Many say upcoming elections, dominated by junta-backed parties, offer little hope of change or a safe return home. With limited support, no formal refugee policy, and fears of renewed violence, displaced families face growing uncertainty about their future.

Al Jazeera’s Victoria Gatenby reports.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Palestinians in Gaza have begun returning to Friday prayers in mosques damaged or destroyed by Israeli strikes. For the first time in months, the call to prayer echoed through the historic Al Omari mosque in Gaza City, marking a small step toward normalcy amid the ruins.

Al Jazeera’s Hani Mahmoud reports.

description:
A ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia has come into effect after weeks of deadly fighting across the border. Al Jazeera’s Assed Baig says artillery fire has stopped but the next 72 hours will be a critical test of whether the truce holds. Hundreds of thousands of displaced civilians are hoping it lasts.

author: Al Jazeera English
description:
Thailand and Cambodia’s defence ministers are set to meet at a border checkpoint as negotiations to end their ongoing conflict enter a fourth day. The renewed violence, which erupted in early December despite a US-backed peace deal, has drawn growing international pressure on both sides. The cross-border clashes have forced nearly one million people to flee their homes.

Al Jazeera’s  Assed Baig reports.
